details:
Several vulnerabilites are fixed in Asterisk, an Open Source PBX and telephony toolkit.


* [CVE-2019-13161](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-13161)
An attacker was able to crash Asterisk when handling an SDP answer to an
outgoing T.38 re-invite.
* [CVE-2019-18610](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-18610)
Remote authenticated Asterisk Manager Interface (AMI) users without
system authorization could execute arbitrary system commands.
* [CVE-2019-18790](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-18790)
A SIP call hijacking vulnerability.


For Debian 8 Jessie, these problems have been fixed in version
1:11.13.1~dfsg-2+deb8u7.


We recommend that you upgrade your asterisk packages.


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
